newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia govt rejects Senate recall on corruption.
newsitem.headline: Australia govt rejects Senate recall on corruption.

text.p: The Australian government on Tuesday rejected demands that the upper house Senate be recalled immediately to demote key senator Mal Colston as polls showed voters deserting it over its handling of corruption accusations against the Queensland senator.

It was not worth recalling the Senate early merely to prevent Colston, accused of corruption, keeping his deputy president's salary until the scheduled re-assembly of the upper house on May 6 forced his departure, government senate leader Robert Hill told reporters.
